item.title: Boris Johnson said bodies 'could pile high' during lockdown discussion
item.description: The BBC has been told Boris Johnson made the remarks in lockdown talks, but the PM denies using the phrase.

item.title: Boris Johnson says any flat revamp donations will be declared
item.description: Labour wants the elections watchdog to launch a formal probe into how refurbishments were paid for.

item.title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe sentenced to a year in Iran prison
item.description: The British-Iranian also faces a one-year travel ban after charges of propaganda activities in Iran.

item.title: Covid-19 in India: Patients struggle at home as hospitals choke
item.description: India's Covid sick struggle to get treatment at home due to black marketing of oxygen and drugs.

item.title: Oscars 2021: Nomadland, Anthony Hopkins and Daniel Kaluuya share glory
item.description: Nomadland takes three top awards, with wins for British stars Sir Anthony Hopkins and Daniel Kaluuya.

item.title: Tributes to 'hero' who died in River Thames rescue bid
item.description: Folajimi Olubunmi-Adewole's body was found in the water about six hours after he leapt in to help.

item.title: Shops, pubs and pools reopen in Scotland
item.description: Travel restrictions are also eased, allowing people to travel between Scotland and other parts of the UK.

item.title: Ex-Serco bosses cleared of fraud over alleged tagging scandal
item.description: Nicholas Woods and Simon Marshall were charged over an alleged scandal involving tagging criminals.

item.title: Line of Duty: Penultimate episode achieves record ratings
item.description: An average audience of 11m viewers tune into the sixth instalment in the BBC drama's sixth series.

item.title: Elite rugby players join dementia-prevention study
item.description: England's Ben Kay and Wales' Shane Williams are among those recruited.

item.title: Covid-19: Bereaved families disappointed by government response to inquiry
item.description: The government says there is "no capacity", but bereaved families say a probe could save lives.

item.title: Oscars 2021: Director Chloé Zhao wins for Nomadland
item.description: Chloé Zhao, Sir Anthony Hopkins and Daniel Kaluuya were amongst the winners of the 2021 Academy Awards

item.title: Google Argentina's domain name bought by man for £2
item.description: The web designer said he did not think it was possible, but Google regained control of it very quickly.

item.title: Abrdn: Standard Life Aberdeen vowel-less rebrand mocked
item.description: The firm says the change will make its brand more "dynamic", but some social media users do not agree.

item.title: Man living alone on Italian island to leave after 32 years
item.description: Mauro Morandi, 81, moved to Budelli in 1989 but has faced pressure from the island's owners to leave.

item.title: Syrian refugee faces bankruptcy over cladding on UK flat
item.description: Bassel lost his flat in the war in Syria and is now at risk of losing everything again, as a victim of flammable cladding.

item.title: 'We do like a rave!' Inside the UK's last lesbian bars
item.description: There are only a few fixed lesbian venues left in the UK, and they are having to adapt to keep going.

item.title: Space junk map tracks 200 ‘ticking time bombs’
item.description: Large defunct rocket bodies have the potential to break into thousands of pieces, threatening functioning satellites that provide vital services like GPS.

item.title: Chernobyl nuclear disaster: ‘Three-day evacuation lasted 35 years’
item.description: Lyudmila Honchar was four when she had to leave her home in Pripyat, Ukraine after the Chernobyl nuclear disaster. Now she's going home.

item.title: London mayoral race 2021: What did the audience think of the debate?
item.description: The audience reacts to the debate between Sadiq Khan, Shaun Bailey, Sian Berry and Luisa Porritt.

item.title: The Papers: 'PM under pressure' and 'India at breaking point'
item.description: Several front pages continue to focus on questions facing Boris Johnson over the renovation of his Downing Street flat.

item.title: 'Apocalyptic' landscape in aftermath of volcanic eruptions on St Vincent.
item.description: The island of St Vincent has been blanketed in ash, impacting infrastructure and agriculture.

item.title: Oscars 2021: The railway station now a hosting venue
item.description: Union Station in Los Angeles will be one of the venues for this year's Oscars.

item.title: Oscars 2021: 'Sluggish' ceremony leaves critics cold
item.description: Reviewers are not kind to an event described as both "painfully earnest" and "badly miscalculated".

item.title: Facebook v Apple: The ad tracking row heats up
item.description: Why is there is a dispute between the two tech giants and does it matter to you?

item.title: Downing Street refurbishment: What is the row over Boris Johnson's flat?
item.description: Boris Johnson is facing questions over how expensive works on his Downing Street flat were paid for.

item.title: Oscars 2021: 13 major red carpet looks from the Academy Awards
item.description: All the suits, sparkles and sequins from Sunday night's Academy Awards.

item.title: The salmon you buy in the future may be farmed on land
item.description: A giant fish farm in Florida is rearing salmon for the US market in a huge indoor facility.

item.title: Can Western brands recover from consumer backlash in China?
item.description: Some foreign companies are facing a boycott in China - they are not the first and won't be the last.

item.title: The Voice: Grace Holden tells of opening up about her grief
item.description: Grace Holden found talking about her mum's death hard - until she opened up about it on The Voice.

item.title: Chloe Zhao, from 'outsider' to Hollywood history-maker
item.description: Chinese-born, British-educated, US-based Zhao is the first woman of colour to win best director.

item.title: 'I will not return to work': Myanmar coup cripples healthcare system
item.description: Myanmar's medical workers are finding themselves torn between their patients and a military government.

item.title: 2021 elections: A simple guide to the Scottish, Welsh and local elections
item.description: A bumper crop of elections are being held on 6 May across England, Scotland and Wales.

item.title: IPL: Ravichandran Ashwin, Adam Zampa, Kane Richardson & Andrew Tye leave amid Covid-19 concerns
item.description: Australians Adam Zampa, Kane Richardson and Andrew Tye return home from the IPL as India's Ravichandran Ashwin takes a break to support his family.

item.title: Why Spurs face 'huge summer' after 'disastrous few months' – Jenas on what next for Tottenham
item.description: MOTD2 pundit and former Tottenham midfielder Jermaine Jenas explains why Spurs have got much bigger issues than Sunday's Carabao Cup final defeat by Manchester City.

item.title: Trump and Bingham stroll into World Championship quarter-finals
item.description: Tournament favourite Judd Trump and 2015 champion Stuart Bingham stroll into the World Championship quarter-finals.

item.title: From collecting galacticos to personal heartbreak - inside the mind of European Super League architect Perez
item.description: Portrayed as greedy and some kind of devil figure for his role in plans for a European Super League, what is Florentino Perez really like?

item.title: Claressa Shields on MMA debut, inequality in boxing and fighting Savannah Marshall
item.description: Before her MMA debut, boxing world champion and "the Greatest Woman of All Time" Claressa Shields discusses her plan for global domination.

item.title: Henry, Bergkamp and Vieira join Spotify owner's bid to buy Arsenal
item.description: Arsenal legends Thierry Henry, Dennis Bergkamp and Patrick Vieira join Spotify founder and billionaire Daniel Ek's bid to buy the club.

item.title: Covid: What is the rule of six and what are the social distancing rules?
item.description: Lockdown rules are being eased further in England and Wales so more people can meet up outside.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People 44 or over in England are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: India Covid: Patients dying without oxygen amid Delhi surge
item.description: Delhi hospitals run out of beds and oxygen as families struggle to save their loved ones.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on transport?
item.description: As UK coronavirus restrictions continue to be relaxed, public transport could become much busier.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: When can I go on holiday abroad or in the UK?
item.description: A traffic light system ranking foreign countries by coronavirus risk is to be introduced - the rules on UK holidays are also easing.

item.title: Covid: Which areas are being mass tested for variants?
item.description: People who live, work or travel through two south London boroughs are being urged to take a Covid-19 test.

item.title: Which countries are on the red list and what are the quarantine rules?
item.description: India has now been added to the UK Government's Covid "red list" of countries.

item.title: India Covid crisis: Did election rallies help spread virus?
item.description: Did campaigning for state elections in India help coronavirus to spread?

item.title: Covid: Restaurants and pubs are reopening, but what are the rules?
item.description: Pubs, cafes and restaurants will reopen in Wales and Scotland on Monday 26 April.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: A nightmare on repeat - India is running out of oxygen again
item.description: Facing a rising wave of coronavirus, and record case numbers, India finds itself battling for breath.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Pubs, cafes and restaurants are reopening in Wales and Scotland - as part of significant easing of lockdown rules.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 33 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: What is a Covid passport and what are the UK's plans?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Is the Australia-NZ travel bubble the way ahead?
item.description: Australia and New Zealand have quarantine-free travel, but will other countries follow their lead?

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: Covid: When will children return to school and what are the rules?
item.description: Children are returning to school across the UK, after months of enforced home-schooling.

item.title: How the Bay of Pigs invasion began - and failed - 60 years on
item.description: The story of the attempted overthrow of Castro's regime in Cuba, as told by the men who were there.

item.title: Afghanistan War: How can the West fight terrorism after leaving?
item.description: As Western troops prepare to go, there are concerns over the future of counter-terrorism operations.

item.title: Big Dog's Backyard Ultra: The toughest, weirdest race you've never heard of
item.description: The format might be simple - winning this race is anything but. Big Dog's Backyard Ultra is an unusually punishing challenge.

item.title: 'My sister took her life, petrified at facing her ex in court'
item.description: Gemma Robinson died just days before she was due to see her ex-partner in court.

item.title: The disabled doctors not believed by their colleagues
item.description: People often feel nervous when they visit a doctor, but what if you are a doctor but your colleagues don't believe you're ill?

item.title: The homeless drug addict who became a professor
item.description: Jesse Thistle, a high school dropout, overcame addiction and homelessness to pursue an academic career.
